itinerary.mapNote: Sacred cedar forest pilgrimage route. Ōji shrines. 200m.
Grand Shrine at heart of Kumano. Ancient pilgrimage end. 130m.
Kumano River crossing. Remote mountain hamlet. 140m.
Japan's tallest waterfall 133m. Nachi Taisha shrine above. 20m.

waypoints.name: Takijiri-ōji (Start)
waypoints.note: Sacred gateway to the Kumano Kodō. UNESCO World Heritage.

waypoints.name: Kumano Hongū Taisha
waypoints.note: Grand Shrine. Largest torii gate in Japan at old site.

waypoints.name: Kumano Hayatama Taisha
waypoints.note: Second Grand Shrine on Kumano River. Boat approach.

waypoints.name: Nachi-no-Taki Falls
waypoints.note: Japan's tallest free-fall waterfall 133m. Sacred site.

waypoints.name: Seiganto-ji Pagoda
waypoints.note: Three-storey pagoda framing Nachi Falls. Iconic image.
